Hao Xu 许浩

I am a third year Master student at University of Chinese Academy of Sciences (UCAS), advised by Prof. Min Zhu. I work with a number of chill and smart people in the Ocean Acoustic Technology lab. Previously, I earned my bachelor degree in Telecommunication Engineering from Wuhan University of Technology (WUT) in 2011.
Research interests: signal processing detection techniques and mobile sensing systems. I also love Mathematics, Football and Programming.

  • Research

  • Publications

  • About Me

Underwater acoustic communication system for manned deep submersible JiaoLong. (The First manned subsmersible for China)

Underwater acoustic transmission of images, human voice, data and texts between vehicle under 7000m depth and surface ship was accomplished of this underwater acoustic communication system.

  • Processed the data received from all sea trials, address the communication problems caused by the deep sea acoustic channel.
  • Developed the more reliable turbo equalization based on the channel estimation for deep sea coherent communication channel.
  • Proposed soft iterated channel estimation with phase locked loop to track the channel response with rapid phase variation in underwater acoustic communication.

    • This project is funded by the National 863 High-Tech Foundation, PI: Min Zhu.

    Research News: Sina News, ScienceNet News, Wikipedia, Youtube, CNTV News, and Global Times

    Robot for Robot Wars Competition.

    We design a powerful robot to participate in the famous Robocup Competition (just like the famous TV show: Robot Wars). This kind of robot needs to detect the own positions and the opponet on a fixed platform, then the robot push the opponent away from the platform for victory. To meet these needs, we used the circuits of the microcontroller and sensors, the efficient control algorithm to attact the opponent. Besides, our local computer would record the data from the robot in competition from the platform by the wireless RF module.

  • Designed the microcontroller boards to control wireless module, color LCD display, RAM/Flash interface.
  • Designed the scheme to make all wireless link operate successful. Programmed on FPGA to realize the complicated DSP algorithm like FIR filters, FFT for data processing.

    • This project won the first prize in national Robocup competition.

    Research News: Tudou , Sina News

    Underwater acoustic network, Signal processing in physical layer communication

    Electromagnetic waves can’t be used for data transmission in the ocean, so underwater wireless networks are generally formed by acoustically connected ocean-bottom sensors, autonomous underwater vehicles, and a surface station, which provides a link to control center.

  • Time Reversal with Turbo Equalization: Proposed time reversal multi-channel combining to simplify the turbo equalization. Investigated turbo principle of exchanging soft information between decoders and equalizers. The length of the turbo equalizer decreased to 10% to that of the multi-channel turbo equalization.
  • Markov Chain Monte Carlo equalizer: Investigated turbo principle of exchanging soft information between decoders and equalizers which can be realized by linear filters and Markov Chain Monte Carlo equalizer. Joint Optimization between Time revervsal and Turbo equalization can have a superior performance over adaptive equalization with turbo decoding and a limited complexity for application.
  • Data Radio Networks: Designed the wireless network of data radio in CSMA/CD protocol. Designed, implemented, and evaluated the GUI on computer to diagnose and supervise the whole aquatic network.

    • This project is funded by the National 863 High-Tech Foundation, PI: Min Zhu.
